metadata.name: Python Image Load By Non-Python Process
metadata.comment: Detects the image load of "Python Core" by a non-Python process. This might be indicative of a Python script bundled with Py2Exe.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(device.desc) = lower('python core') AND NOT (contains(lower(process.name), lower('python')) AND (startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\program files\\\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\program files (x86)\\\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\programdata\\\\anaconda3\\\\')))) AND NOT process.name is null)

output.summary: Detects the image load of "Python Core" by a non-Python process. This might be indicative of a Python script bundled with Py2Exe.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate Py2Exe Binaries 2. Known false positive caused with Python Anaconda References: https://www.py2exe.org/, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/unit-42-technical-analysis-seaduke/
